intro: Hyperbaena longiuscula var. clements, commonly known as the narrowleaf hyperbaena, is a flowering plant species native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. This variant is distinguished by its narrower leaves compared to other varieties within the species.
